snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio’s proposal for New York City includes significant new spending on education, social services and municipal payrolls — but virtually no service cuts or new channels of revenue.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio announces $73.9 billion budget plan that includes significant new spending on education, social services and municipal payrolls--but virtually no service cuts or new channels of revenue; proposal would increase spending by 6 percent compared with 2013 plan.

byline.original: By MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM and KATE TAYLOR

lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio’s proposal for New York City includes significant new spending on education, social services and municipal payrolls — but virtually no service cuts or new channels of revenue.

headline.main: De Blasio’s Budget Raises Spending Without Big Cuts
headline.print_headline: Mayor’s Budget Raises Spending Without Big Cuts
